topic: How to implement cron-driven tasks using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement cron-driven tasks using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Implementing Cron-Driven Tasks Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide demonstrates how to set up and run periodic tasks with FastAPI in a cron-like manner using the APScheduler library in Python 3.12+.",

  "key_points": [
    "FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+",
    "APScheduler is a popular library for scheduling periodic tasks in Python",
    "This example will utilize both FastAPI and APScheduler to create a web application that runs scheduled tasks",
    "FastAPI will be used to create an API endpoint for triggering the scheduled task"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
import fastapi\nfrom apscheduler.schedulers.background import BackgroundScheduler\n\
app = fastapi.FastAPI()\n\
scheduler = BackgroundScheduler()\n\
\n@app.get('/task/')\nasync def task():\n    pass\n\nscheduler.add_job(func=task, trigger='cron', hour='*/1', minute='*/1')\nscheduler.start()\n\napp.run(debug=True)\n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python: 3.12+",
    "FastAPI: >=0.70.0",
    "APScheduler: >=3.8.0"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Ensure that your system's cron daemon is running to execute tasks at the specified times.",
    "Make sure you have the necessary permissions to run the scheduled task on your system",
    "For more complex scheduling needs, consult the APScheduler documentation"
  ]
}
